intro: Commiphora stolzii, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small evergreen shrub native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and produces a resinous sap that has been used traditionally for its aromatic properties. Commiphora stolzii typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional medicinal contexts.
